missionProperties.campaignName: Hondo Ohnaka (Friend for Hire) Villain Pack

changeRepositionOverride.theText: Block access to the E-XD infiltrator droid.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 2
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 3
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
You corner a surprised Hondo in his hideout just as he cracks open the crate. Spewing exaggerated apologies, the pirate agrees to give up the Imperial shipment. 

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} The door is locked.

eventActions.theText: Hondo backs away just as an Imperial E-XD infiltrator droid bursts from the container.

eventActions.bonuses:
CHARGE GENERATORS: This figure gains 1 {h}.
AUTOMATED REPAIRS: This figure recovers 2 {H}.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{Q} Move 2 to attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 2 away from the Rebels.
{A} Move 4 away from the Rebels.
{-} This figure gains 1 {g}.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The Imperial mission token represents the E-XD Infiltrator Droid.
{-} If the E-XD has been defeated, a figure can interact with the door ({K} or {I}) to try and open it. That figure may suffer 1 {C} during that test to reroll any number of dice.
{-} The mission will progress when the door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 6, or when all heroes are wounded.
Defeat the E-XD Infiltrator Droid.

{-} The Imperial mission token represents the E-XD Infiltrator Droid.
{-} The door is locked. If the E-XD has been defeated, a figure can interact with the door ({K} or {I}) to try and open it. That figure may suffer 1 {C} during that test to reroll any number of dice.
{-} The mission will progress when the door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 6, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
With the tracking device securely and secretly implanted, you make a good show of being "defeated" as you retreat. The data from that droid should prove extremely valuable to the Rebellion.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
Unable to catch back up with Hondo or the mysterious Imperial droid, you are forced to retreat to the safety of your ship, left with only bad news to report.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} If playing this mission as a side mission, the Imperial player receives <color="red">Hondo Ohnaka</color> (Friend for Hire) as a villain.

eventActions.theText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

globalEvents.name: Mini campaign Win
globalEvents.eventText:
After the empire has left, you confront Hondo. "Yes, I betrayed you, but the empire left me no choice," he claims. "And now I've lost my new droid, and I'm empty-handed. We are truly united in misfortune!"

N-4M contacts you. "I'm receiving the droid's telemetry data and am relaying it to our allies in the Rebellion right now," he reports.

You assure Hondo that you won't be so lenient with him next time, then you let him go and return to your ship.

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText:
You dock with a VCX-100 freighter. Once aboard, you meet the rest of the crew, including Captain Hera Syndulla. “We can use all the help we can get,” she says, “and if my people trust you, so do I. We've got more work to do than people to do it.

“Have you heard of Grand Admiral Thrawn? He’s got the whole sector on high alert. We can barely move.” She leans against the small table in the middle of the room. “We have allies on Seelos, Wolffe and Gregor, who have salvaged some Imperial codes from a stolen walker, but they need a hand escaping the Empire. We've also got a lead on an old smuggler’s hideout on Devaron containing charts of the best smuggling routes through the sector. If we can get them, we can dodge Imperial patrols and won't need codes at all.” She turns to you. “If you can help us out here, I'll send one of my crew along.”

{-} The heroes collectively choose whether to assist Wolffe and Gregor or investigate the smuggler’s hideout.
{-} If the heroes choose to assist Wolffe and Gregor, the next active mission is “Sands of Seelos”.
{-} If the heroes choose to investigate the smuggler’s hideout, the next active mission is “Duel on Devaron”.

globalEvents.name: Mini campaign Defeat
globalEvents.eventText:
You escape to a nearby warehouse and hide behind a tower of cargo containers stacked to the ceiling. When your pursuers stop searching for you, Hondo and the Imperial droid are long gone. The Imperial infiltrator droid worries you ... as does the thought that Hondo and the Empire working together may have been more than a coincidence.

It's time to meet your new allies.

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText:
You dock with a VCX-100 freighter. Once aboard, you meet the rest of the crew, including Captain Hera Syndulla. “We can use all the help we can get,” she says, “and if my people trust you, so do I. We've got more work to do than people to do it.

“Have you heard of Grand Admiral Thrawn? He’s got the whole sector on high alert. We can barely move.” She leans against the small table in the middle of the room. “We have allies on Seelos, Wolffe and Gregor, who have salvaged some Imperial codes from a stolen walker, but they need a hand escaping the Empire. We've also got a lead on an old smuggler’s hideout on Devaron containing charts of the best smuggling routes through the sector. If we can get them, we can dodge Imperial patrols and won't need codes at all.” She turns to you. “If you can help us out here, I'll send one of my crew along.”

{-} The heroes collectively choose whether to assist Wolffe and Gregor or investigate the smuggler’s hideout.
{-} If the heroes choose to assist Wolffe and Gregor, the next active mission is “Sands of Seelos”.
{-} If the heroes choose to investigate the smuggler’s hideout, the next active mission is “Duel on Devaron”.

globalEvents.name: No campaign
globalEvents.eventText:
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Droid Defeated 1
globalEvents.eventText:
The damaged droid bounds through a door, hastily welding it behind him. If you can place a tracker on it, you can find out where it is taking its intel.

{-} A figure can interact with the door ({K} or {I}) to try and open it. That figure may suffer 1 {C} during that test to reroll any number of dice.

eventActions.theText: Leave the hideout.
Block access to the door.

globalEvents.name: Call for Backup
globalEvents.eventText: Some of Hondo's goons appear to have been alerted by the pirate.

eventActions.theText:
You attempt to force the door open.

{-} Test {K} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below. You may suffer 1 {C} during that test to reroll any number of dice.

inputList.theText:
You make some progress, but the door remains shut. You need to keep trying. 

{-} Place 1 strain token on the door for each {B} result gained.

globalEvents.name: Follow the Source
globalEvents.eventText: The door slides open to reveal the dusty wasteland of Florrum.

entityProperties.name: Door 1
entityProperties.theText: A dusty door leads outside. It is locked.

eventActions.theText: Enemies are already waiting for you.
To the side, you see Hondo Ohnaka grinning apologetically. "I am so sorry, my friends, but I am sure we can still make business in the future, no?", he says, drawing his blaster.
The infiltrator droid is resting nearby. The repair protocols have already restored most damages. They have even enhanced its armor.

eventActions.bonuses:
CHARGE GENERATORS: This figure gains 1 {h}.
AUTOMATED REPAIRS: This figure recovers 2 {H}.

Defeat the E-XD Infiltrator Droid a second time.

globalEvents.name: Droid Defeated 2
globalEvents.eventText: The E-XD Infiltrator Droid collapses in a heap of scrap. If you can place a tracker on it before it repairs itself again, you can trace it back.

entityProperties.name: E-XD 3
entityProperties.theText: {-} A Rebel figure can interact with the incapacitated E-XD to try and place a tracking beacon on it ({J}). When they do, "Place Beacon".

eventActions.theText:
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with the incapacitated E-XD to try and place a tracking beacon on it ({J}). Click the mission token off the map and select "Place Beacon".
{-} The Rebels win when the tracking beacon is placed.
Place the tracking beacon.

{-} The Imperial mission token represents the incapacitated E-XD Infiltrator Droid.
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with the incapacitated E-XD to try and place a tracking beacon on it ({J}). Click the mission token off the map and select "Place Beacon".
{-} The Rebels win when the tracking beacon is placed.
{-} The Rebels lose at the end of Round 6, or when all heroes are wounded.

You try to place the tracking beacon somewhere where the droid's systems won't find it.

{-} Test {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the E-XD, then discard all strain tokens on the E-XD. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText: You don't find a suitable location for the beacon.
